climbs.name: Salt N Pepper Shakers
climbs.fa: Bill GIlson and Al Seeger  1957 Ground Up

content.description: Scramble up to the grassy gully. This climb starts on the Southeast side of the formation. Climb up and stem across and make a committing move then run it out for the last 20 feet to the summit. There is no anchor on this climb NSR.
content.location: from cleft go up and left, walk around rock, walk to base of shakers "grassy patch"

content.description: Salt N Pepper Shakers are obvious from the road if you know where to look. The formation was first climbed by Bill Gilson and Al Seeger in 1957 Ground up. They resemble two pointy boulders balancing on top of a formation.  a Needles Style Rap (NSR) is required to get down and both known routes are easy but committing.
